summary: The bill, the Veterans Accessibility Advisory Committee Act of 2025, mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a committee focused on improving accessibility for veterans with disabilities. This committee will advise on accessibility of VA information, services, facilities, and the Veterans Community Care Program. It will include veterans, disability experts, VA employees, and representatives from veteran service organizations. The committee will issue reports to the Secretary and Congress, focusing on access barriers and making recommendations. The bill also addresses the abolition of inactive VA advisory committees.
